items.description: G'day everyone, welcome to issue #336 of Weekly Xamarin - a snapshot of what's been happening in the Xamarin and MAUI communities over the last week.
items.description_markdown: G'day everyone, welcome to issue #336 of Weekly Xamarin - a snapshot of what's been happening in the Xamarin and MAUI communities over the last week.

items.title: Announcing .NET Community Toolkit v8.0.0 Preview 1
items.description:
Another community toolkit? Sure, why not!?! This one looks great, with lots of MVVM style enhancements you would have needed to use things like FODY for in the past. Definitely worth a look.

Announcing .NET Community Toolkit v8.0.0 Preview 1 by Sergio Pedri
items.description_markdown:
Another community toolkit? Sure, why not!?! This one looks great, with lots of MVVM style enhancements you would have needed to use things like FODY for in the past. Definitely worth a look.

[**Announcing .NET Community Toolkit v8.0.0 Preview 1**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/ifdef-windows/announcing-net-community-toolkit-v8-0-0-preview-1/) by [Sergio Pedri](https://github.com/Sergio0694)

items.title: C# 10 with Xamarin.Forms
items.description:
Want to use some of those cool new things like file-scoped namespaces and global usings in your Xamarin.Forms app? Sure.

items.title: Learning about Clipboard in Xamarin Forms
items.description:
Clipboard is something we don't often think about, but something we use all the time and a great way for users to transfer data between applications.

Learning about Clipboard in Xamarin Forms by Leomaris Reyes
items.description_markdown:
Clipboard is something we don't often think about, but something we use all the time and a great way for users to transfer data between applications.

[**Learning about Clipboard in Xamarin Forms**](https://askxammy.com/learning-about-clipboard-in-xamarin-forms/) by [Leomaris Reyes](https://twitter.com/leomarisreyes11)

items.title: Exploring Overlays
items.description:
In this post Michael digs into WindowOverlays. What are they? How is it implemented natively? How does it maintain state, including during page navigation? When should I use them? How is it related to the traditional navigation style and Shell? What can we use it for?

.NET MAUI - Exploring Overlays - Michael Ridland by Michael Ridland
items.description_markdown:
In this post Michael digs into WindowOverlays. What are they? How is it implemented natively? How does it maintain state, including during page navigation? When should I use them? How is it related to the traditional navigation style and Shell? What can we use it for?

[**.NET MAUI - Exploring Overlays - Michael Ridland**](https://michaelridland.com/net-maui/net-maui-exploring-overlays/) by [Michael Ridland](https://twitter.com/rid00z)

items.title: Organize your .NET MAUI MauiProgram / Startup file
items.description:
This post discusses best practices for startup/program organization files while developing the .NET Multi-platform App UI (.NET MAUI) project. How we can make it better and how to make it more maintainable.

Organize your .NET MAUI MauiProgram / Startup file by Luis Matos
items.description_markdown:
This post discusses best practices for startup/program organization files while developing the .NET Multi-platform App UI (.NET MAUI) project. How we can make it better and how to make it more maintainable.

[**Organize your .NET MAUI MauiProgram / Startup file**](https://luismts.com/organize-your-net-maui-mauiprogram-startup-file/) by [Luis Matos](https://twitter.com/luismatosluna)

items.title: Calculating distance between your device and a location
items.description:
In Xamarin.Forms showing the distance between two points can be done with Xamarin.Essentials, but in .NET MAUI it’s even easier. The .NET MAUI essentials are built into the framework itself and doesn’t rely on an external package.

Calculating distance between your device and a location with .NET MAUI by Andreas Nesheim
items.description_markdown:
In Xamarin.Forms showing the distance between two points can be done with Xamarin.Essentials, but in .NET MAUI it’s even easier. The .NET MAUI essentials are built into the framework itself and doesn’t rely on an external package.

[**Calculating distance between your device and a location with .NET MAUI**](https://www.andreasnesheim.no/calculating-distance-between-your-device-and-a-location-with-net-maui/) by [Andreas Nesheim](https://twitter.com/andreasnesheim)

embedded_links.title: **Calculating distance between your device and a location with .NET MAUI**

items.title: .NET MAUI Preview 12: Shell Dependency Injection is Here!
items.description:
As we're getting closer to GA, the updates get a bit less exciting, but for preview 12 we got some cool Shell features! In this video we will go over what is new in .NET MAUI Preview 12 and specifically I will show you how to work with the new .NET MAUI Shell Dependency Injection!

.NET MAUI Preview 12: Shell Dependency Injection is Here! by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
As we're getting closer to GA, the updates get a bit less exciting, but for preview 12 we got some cool Shell features! In this video we will go over what is new in .NET MAUI Preview 12 and specifically I will show you how to work with the new .NET MAUI Shell Dependency Injection!

[**.NET MAUI Preview 12: Shell Dependency Injection is Here!**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4kWSgwn9VSY) by [Gerald Versluis](https://twitter.com/jfversluis)

embedded_links.title: **.NET MAUI Preview 12: Shell Dependency Injection is Here!**

items.title: .NET MAUI Preview 12 - Constructor & Dependency Injection Everywhere!
items.description:
.NET MAUI Preview 12 is here along with Visual Studio 2022 17.1 Preview 3 and there are some awesome new features including built in support for constructor injection when using Shell! There is also the .NET 6 unification for iOS, new handlers, Windows extended toolbar, and more!

.NET MAUI Preview 12 - Constructor & Dependency Injection Everywhere! by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
.NET MAUI Preview 12 is here along with Visual Studio 2022 17.1 Preview 3 and there are some awesome new features including built in support for constructor injection when using Shell! There is also the .NET 6 unification for iOS, new handlers, Windows extended toolbar, and more!

[**.NET MAUI Preview 12 - Constructor & Dependency Injection Everywhere!**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ugem4UbAtC0) by [James Montemagno](https://twitter.com/jamesmontemagno)

embedded_links.title: **.NET MAUI Preview 12 - Constructor & Dependency Injection Everywhere!**
